title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@posit.co. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to glysmith
text: outlines propose change glysmith. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to glysmith
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to glysmith
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to glysmith
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("glycoverse/glysmith", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to glysmith
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use Air apply style, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to glysmith
text: Please note glysmith project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

Typically don’t look repo sufficient quantity issues accumulates, ’s burst intense activity focus efforts. makes development efficient avoids expensive context switching problems, cost taking longer get back . process makes good reprex particularly important might multiple months initial report start working . can’t reproduce bug, can’t fix !

what: Analyze your data with a single line of code
title: Get Started with glysmith
text: demonstrate using built-experiment object glyexp. N-glycoproteomics dataset containing 12 samples across four different liver conditions: healthy controls (H), hepatitis (M), cirrhosis (Y), hepatocellular carcinoma (C), 3 samples group. Please note, dataset raw normalized imputed. work data, can use glyread import outputs tools like pGlyco3, MSFragger-Glyco, Byonic; Alternatively, can create experiment object. details, see Get Started glyread Creating Experiments. Now, let’s run default analysis pipeline just single line code. ’s ! ’ve completed following steps one go: Preprocessed data using glyclean::auto_clean(). Summarized experiment glyexp::summarize_experiment(). Performed principal component analysis glystats::gly_pca(). Conducted differential expression analysis using glystats::gly_limma(). Plotted volcano plot via glyvis::plot_volcano(). Generated heatmap significant glycoforms using glyvis::plot_heatmap(). Conducted GO enrichment analysis using glystats::gly_enrich_go(). Performed KEGG enrichment analysis using glystats::gly_enrich_kegg(). Performed Reactome enrichment analysis using glystats::gly_enrich_reactome(). Derived site-specific traits using glydet::derive_traits(). Conducted differential trait analysis glystats::gly_limma(). Generated heatmap significant site-specific derived traits via glyvis::plot_heatmap(). comprehensive analysis pipeline!
code: real_experiment #>  #> ── Glycoproteomics Experiment ────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> ℹ Expression matrix: 12 samples, 4262 variables #> ℹ Sample information fields: group <fct> #> ℹ Variable information fields: peptide <chr>, peptide_site <int>, protein <chr>, protein_site <int>, gene <chr>, glycan_composition <glyrpr_c>, glycan_structure <glyrpr_s> result <- forge_analysis(real_experiment) result

what: Save all results with one line of code
title: Get Started with glysmith
text: results, ’s next? can export tables plots target directory just single line code. Running create folder path//save following content: README.md: Describes saved outputs. experiment.rds: processed experiment object. meta.rds: metadata list. plots/: plots generated pipeline. tables/: tables output analysis. Give try !

what: One line to generate a report
title: Get Started with glysmith
text: ’re developing advanced report generation features, now, can use polish_report() generate report directly results. default, report open automatically browser ’s finished. Now exciting part! Set use_ai = TRUE let Large Language Model (LLM) help polish report. currently use deepseek-chat, offers cost-effectiveness solid performance. use feature, need provide API key, either setting environment variable DEEPSEEK_API_KEY. can obtain API key https://platform.deepseek.com. ’re continually working make report generation readable informative. Check back months see ’s new!

title: Get Started with glysmith
text: may noticed unusual names package. First, ‘smith’ glysmith doesn’t refer surname; ’s taken “blacksmith”—someone makes repairs items made iron. functions classes named using blacksmith jargon. example, forge_analysis() “forging” results, quench_result() “quenching” results save , polish_report() “polishing” report improve readability. ’ll learn “blueprint” next section.

title: Get Started with glysmith
text: Imagine visit blacksmith order sword. simply say, “want sword,” blacksmith use default blueprint start working . However, always option bring design—custom blueprint—smith can use sword. Similarly, forge_analysis() uses default blueprint analysis pipeline. can inspect via blueprint_default(). blueprint list steps executed sequentially. can use blueprint() step_ functions create custom blueprint. instance, ’d just like perform differential expression analysis plot volcano plot, : can also save blueprint file reload later: can find references available steps package (list still growing!). simply type step_ hit TAB RStudio view available step functions. start building blueprints, rules keep mind: step_preprocess() generally first step, ’s optional perform preprocessing manually glyclean. steps require others executed first. example, step_volcano() requires least one step_dea_limma(), step_dea_ttest(), step_dea_wilcox() run beforehand. Consult documentation step check dependencies. include duplicate steps within blueprint. instance, can’t add step_dea_limma() twice blueprint. step overwrites data produced earlier step, warning issued. example, including step_dea_limma() step_dea_ttest() overwrite dea_res data former latter step. Ignore warning ’s intend. can also use inquire_blueprint() let Large Language Model (LLM) help create blueprint. use feature, need provide API key, either setting environment variable DEEPSEEK_API_KEY. can obtain API key https://platform.deepseek.com. NOTE: function might stable. Double check blueprint using . Happy forging!
code: blueprint_default() #>  #> ── Blueprint (12 steps) ── #>  #> • step_ident_overview() #> • step_preprocess() #> • step_pca() #> • step_dea_limma() #> • step_volcano() #> • step_heatmap(on = "sig_exp") #> • step_sig_enrich_go() #> • step_sig_enrich_kegg() #> • step_sig_enrich_reactome() #> • step_derive_traits() #> • step_dea_limma(on = "trait_exp") #> • step_heatmap(on = "sig_trait_exp") bp <- blueprint(   step_preprocess(),   step_dea_limma(),   step_volcano(), ) result <- forge_analysis(real_experiment, bp) result write_blueprint(bp, "path/to/save/bp.rds") bp <- read_blueprint("path/to/save/bp.rds") Sys.setenv(DEEPSEEK_API_KEY = "your_api_key") bp <- inquire_blueprint("I want to know what pathways are enriched for my significantly differentially expressed glycoforms.")

what: Full-Featured Analysis Pipeline for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics
title: Full-Featured Analysis Pipeline for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics
text: One Ring rule . — Lord Rings  overwhelmed complexity glycoverse? Imagine package, performing analysis need, PCA, DEA, enrichment, even advanced glycan derived trait analysis, just one line code. Try glysmith! Perform comprehensive analysis pipeline one function call. https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d1eede5f-f919-428b-a5e8-574a8ab6f863

title: Full-Featured Analysis Pipeline for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics
text: can install development version glysmith GitHub :

title: Full-Featured Analysis Pipeline for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics
text: running quench_result line, get organized result folder:  running polish_report line, get report HTML format automatically open default browser:  Note: set use_ai TRUE enable LLM-assisted report generation.
code: library(glyread) library(glysmith)  exp <- read_pglyco3("pglyco3_result.txt", sample_info = "sample_info.csv")  # One line of code for the comprehensive analysis pipeline result <- forge_analysis(exp)  # One line of code to save the results quench_result(result, "path/to/save")  # One line of code to generate a report polish_report(result, "report.html")

title: Create a Blueprint — blueprint
text: blueprint list steps executed order. Type step_ TAB RStudio see available steps.

title: Create a Blueprint — blueprint
text: ... One step objects.

title: Create a Blueprint — blueprint
text: blueprint object.

title: Create a Blueprint — blueprint
code: blueprint(   step_preprocess(),   step_pca(),   step_dea_limma(),  # this comma is ok ) #>  #> ── Blueprint (3 steps) ── #>  #> • step_preprocess() #> • step_pca() #> • step_dea_limma()

title: Default blueprint — blueprint_default
text: blueprint contains following steps: step_ident_overview(): Summarize experiment using glyexp::summarize_experiment(). step_preprocess(): Preprocess data using glyclean::auto_clean(). step_pca(): Principal component analysis using glystats::gly_pca(), plot PCA using glyvis::plot_pca(). step_dea_limma(): Differential analysis using glystats::gly_limma(). step_volcano(): Plot volcano plot using glyvis::plot_volcano(). step_heatmap(= "sig_exp"): Plot heatmap using glyvis::plot_heatmap(). step_sig_enrich_go(): Perform GO enrichment analysis using glystats::gly_enrich_go(). step_sig_enrich_kegg(): Perform KEGG enrichment analysis using glystats::gly_enrich_kegg(). step_sig_enrich_reactome(): Perform Reactome enrichment analysis using glystats::gly_enrich_reactome(). step_derive_traits(): Derive traits using glydet::derive_traits(). step_dea_limma(= "trait_exp"): Differential trait analysis using glystats::gly_limma(). step_heatmap(= "sig_trait_exp"): Plot heatmap using glyvis::plot_heatmap().

title: Default blueprint — blueprint_default
code: blueprint_default(preprocess = TRUE, enrich = TRUE, traits = TRUE)

title: Default blueprint — blueprint_default
text: preprocess Whether include step_preprocess(). enrich Whether include enrichment steps, .e. step_sig_enrich_go(), step_sig_enrich_kegg(), step_sig_enrich_reactome(). traits Whether include derived trait analysis steps, .e. step_derive_traits() step_dea_limma(= "trait_exp").

title: Default blueprint — blueprint_default
text: glysmith_blueprint object.

title: Default blueprint — blueprint_default
code: blueprint_default() #>  #> ── Blueprint (12 steps) ── #>  #> • step_ident_overview() #> • step_preprocess() #> • step_pca() #> • step_dea_limma() #> • step_volcano() #> • step_heatmap(on = "sig_exp") #> • step_sig_enrich_go() #> • step_sig_enrich_kegg() #> • step_sig_enrich_reactome() #> • step_derive_traits() #> • step_dea_limma(on = "trait_exp") #> • step_heatmap(on = "sig_trait_exp")

code: library(glyexp) exp <- real_experiment2 result <- forge_analysis(exp) #> ℹ Identification overview #> ✔ Identification overview [85ms] #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ── Removing variables with too many missing values ── #> ℹ Preprocessing #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ℹ No QC samples found. Using all samples. #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ℹ Applying preset "discovery"... #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ℹ Total removed: 10 (14.93%) variables. #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ✔ Variable removal completed. #> ℹ Preprocessing #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ── Normalizing data ── #> ℹ Preprocessing #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ℹ No QC samples found. Using default normalization method based on experiment type. #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ℹ Experiment type is "glycomics". Using `normalize_median_quotient()` + `normalize_total_area()`. #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ✔ Normalization completed. #> ℹ Preprocessing #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ── Normalizing data (Total Area) ── #> ℹ Preprocessing #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ✔ Total area normalization completed. #> ℹ Preprocessing #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ── Imputing missing values ── #> ℹ Preprocessing #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ℹ No QC samples found. Using default imputation method based on sample size. #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ℹ Sample size > 100, using `impute_miss_forest()`. #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ! `step_preprocess()` failed. Skipping... Error:  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ✔ Preprocessing [243ms] #>  #> ℹ Principal component analysis #> ! `step_pca()` failed. Skipping... Error: cannot rescale a constant/zero column to unit variance #> ℹ Principal component analysis #> ✔ Principal component analysis [17ms] #>  #> ℹ Differential expression analysis (limma) #> ℹ Number of groups: 4 #> ℹ Differential expression analysis (limma) #> ℹ Groups: "H", "M", "Y", and "C" #> ℹ Differential expression analysis (limma) #> ℹ Pairwise comparisons will be performed, with levels coming first as reference groups. #> ℹ Differential expression analysis (limma) #> ✔ Differential expression analysis (limma) [227ms] #>  #> ℹ Volcano plot #> ✔ Volcano plot [720ms] #>  #> ℹ Heatmap of significant variables #> ✔ Heatmap of significant variables [104ms] #>  #> ℹ Skipping `step_sig_enrich_go()` because input is not a glycoproteomics experiment and input has more than 2 groups. #> ℹ Skipping `step_sig_enrich_kegg()` because input is not a glycoproteomics experiment and input has more than 2 groups. #> ℹ Skipping `step_sig_enrich_reactome()` because input is not a glycoproteomics experiment and input has more than 2 groups. #> ℹ Derived trait calculation #> ✔ Derived trait calculation [8.2s] #>  #> ℹ Differential trait analysis (limma) #> ℹ Number of groups: 4 #> ℹ Differential trait analysis (limma) #> ℹ Groups: "H", "M", "Y", and "C" #> ℹ Differential trait analysis (limma) #> ℹ Pairwise comparisons will be performed, with levels coming first as reference groups. #> ℹ Differential trait analysis (limma) #> ✔ Differential trait analysis (limma) [84ms] #>  #> ℹ Heatmap of significant traits #> ✔ Heatmap of significant traits [41ms] #>  cast_exp(result) #>  #> ── Glycomics Experiment ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> ℹ Expression matrix: 144 samples, 67 variables #> ℹ Sample information fields: group <fct> #> ℹ Variable information fields: glycan_composition <comp>, glycan_structure <struct> cast_table(result, "summary") #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>   item                       n #>   <chr>                  <dbl> #> 1 total_composition       67   #> 2 total_structure         67   #> 3 composition_per_sample  52.7 #> 4 structure_per_sample    52.7

what: Perform the Whole Analysis Pipeline — forge_analysis
title: Perform the Whole Analysis Pipeline — forge_analysis
text: function performs comprehensive analysis group comparison.

title: Perform the Whole Analysis Pipeline — forge_analysis
Perform the Whole Analysis Pipeline — forge_analysis
text: exp glyexp::experiment() object. blueprint glysmith_blueprint object. Default blueprint_default(). group_col Column name group information sample information. Used various analyses. Default "group".

title: Perform the Whole Analysis Pipeline — forge_analysis
text: glysmith_result object, following components: exp: experiment preprocessing. plots: named list ggplot objects. tables: named list tibbles. meta: named list metadata, containing: explanation: named character vector list explanations plot table, keys like tables$summary plots$pca. steps: character vector steps analysis. log: messages outputs step. blueprint: blueprint used analysis.

title: Perform the Whole Analysis Pipeline — forge_analysis
code: exp <- glyexp::real_experiment2 result <- forge_analysis(exp) #> ℹ Identification overview #> ✔ Identification overview [115ms] #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ── Removing variables with too many missing values ── #> ℹ Preprocessing #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ℹ No QC samples found. Using all samples. #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ℹ Applying preset "discovery"... #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ℹ Total removed: 10 (14.93%) variables. #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ✔ Variable removal completed. #> ℹ Preprocessing #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ── Normalizing data ── #> ℹ Preprocessing #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ℹ No QC samples found. Using default normalization method based on experiment type. #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ℹ Experiment type is "glycomics". Using `normalize_median_quotient()` + `normalize_total_area()`. #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ✔ Normalization completed. #> ℹ Preprocessing #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ── Normalizing data (Total Area) ── #> ℹ Preprocessing #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ✔ Total area normalization completed. #> ℹ Preprocessing #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ── Imputing missing values ── #> ℹ Preprocessing #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ℹ No QC samples found. Using default imputation method based on sample size. #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ℹ Sample size > 100, using `impute_miss_forest()`. #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ! `step_preprocess()` failed. Skipping... Error:  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ✔ Preprocessing [115ms] #>  #> ℹ Principal component analysis #> ! `step_pca()` failed. Skipping... Error: cannot rescale a constant/zero column to unit variance #> ℹ Principal component analysis #> ✔ Principal component analysis [13ms] #>  #> ℹ Differential expression analysis (limma) #> ℹ Number of groups: 4 #> ℹ Differential expression analysis (limma) #> ℹ Groups: "H", "M", "Y", and "C" #> ℹ Differential expression analysis (limma) #> ℹ Pairwise comparisons will be performed, with levels coming first as reference groups. #> ℹ Differential expression analysis (limma) #> ✔ Differential expression analysis (limma) [84ms] #>  #> ℹ Volcano plot #> ✔ Volcano plot [643ms] #>  #> ℹ Heatmap of significant variables #> ✔ Heatmap of significant variables [41ms] #>  #> ℹ Skipping `step_sig_enrich_go()` because input is not a glycoproteomics experiment and input has more than 2 groups. #> ℹ Skipping `step_sig_enrich_kegg()` because input is not a glycoproteomics experiment and input has more than 2 groups. #> ℹ Skipping `step_sig_enrich_reactome()` because input is not a glycoproteomics experiment and input has more than 2 groups. #> ℹ Derived trait calculation #> ✔ Derived trait calculation [3s] #>  #> ℹ Differential trait analysis (limma) #> ℹ Number of groups: 4 #> ℹ Differential trait analysis (limma) #> ℹ Groups: "H", "M", "Y", and "C" #> ℹ Differential trait analysis (limma) #> ℹ Pairwise comparisons will be performed, with levels coming first as reference groups. #> ℹ Differential trait analysis (limma) #> ✔ Differential trait analysis (limma) [82ms] #>  #> ℹ Heatmap of significant traits #> ✔ Heatmap of significant traits [40ms] #>  print(result) #>  #> ── GlySmith Analysis Result  #> Plots: 8, Tables: 4, Data: 6

what: glysmith: Full-Featured Analysis Pipeline for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics — glysmith-package
title: glysmith: Full-Featured Analysis Pipeline for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics — glysmith-package
text: glysmith provides high-level, end--end workflows glycomics glycoproteomics data analysis within glycoverse ecosystem. acts orchestrator integrates data cleaning, quality control, derived trait computation, motif detection, statistical testing, visualization unified, one-command analytical pipelines. Built top experiment() data container domain-knowledge-aware infrastructure provided glyclean, glydet, glymotif, glystats, glyvis, related packages, glysmith enables users quickly forge polished tables, figures, analysis reports suitable publication. package designed reproducibility ease use, allowing novice advanced users obtain standardized structure-aware results minimal code retaining full flexibility customization.

title: glysmith: Full-Featured Analysis Pipeline for Glycomics and Glycoproteomics — glysmith-package
text: Maintainer: Bin Fu 23110220018@m.fudan.edu.cn (ORCID) [copyright holder]

what: Create a Blueprint using Natural Language — inquire_blueprint
title: Create a Blueprint using Natural Language — inquire_blueprint
text: Ask Large Language Model (LLM) create blueprint glycomics glycoproteomics data analysis. use function, need DeepSeek API key. can get DeepSeek API key https://platform.deepseek.com. set environment variable DEEPSEEK_API_KEY API key Sys.setenv(DEEPSEEK_API_KEY = "-api-key").

title: Create a Blueprint using Natural Language — inquire_blueprint
Create a Blueprint using Natural Language — inquire_blueprint
text: description description want analysis. model Model use. Default "deepseek-reasoner". max_retries Maximum number retries AI output invalid. Default 3.

title: Create a Blueprint using Natural Language — inquire_blueprint
text: LLMs can unstable. get error, try another description. Make sure examine returned blueprint carefully ensure want. examples works: "want know pathways enriched differentially expressed glycoforms." "want heatmap pca plot. already performed preprocessing ." "glycomics dataset. want calculate derived traits perform DEA ."

what: Render a HTML Report for GlySmith Results — polish_report
title: Render a HTML Report for GlySmith Results — polish_report
text: Generate self-contained HTML report glysmith_result object. report rendered via rmarkdown::render() using internal R Markdown template. use_ai TRUE, report text polished using LLM (deepseek-chat). use feature, provide API key set environment variable DEEPSEEK_API_KEY running Sys.setenv(DEEPSEEK_API_KEY = "your_api_key"). can apply API key https://platform.deepseek.com.

title: Render a HTML Report for GlySmith Results — polish_report
code: polish_report(   x,   output_file,   title = "GlySmith report",   open = interactive(),   use_ai = FALSE )

title: Render a HTML Report for GlySmith Results — polish_report
text: x glysmith_result object. output_file Path output HTML file. title Report title. open Whether open report browser rendering. use_ai Whether polish report text using AI (deepseek-chat). Default FALSE.

title: Render a HTML Report for GlySmith Results — polish_report
text: normalized path generated HTML file.

title: Render a HTML Report for GlySmith Results — polish_report
code: library(glyexp) exp <- real_experiment2 result <- forge_analysis(exp) #> ℹ Identification overview #> ✔ Identification overview [122ms] #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ── Removing variables with too many missing values ── #> ℹ Preprocessing #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ℹ No QC samples found. Using all samples. #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ℹ Applying preset "discovery"... #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ℹ Total removed: 10 (14.93%) variables. #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ✔ Variable removal completed. #> ℹ Preprocessing #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ── Normalizing data ── #> ℹ Preprocessing #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ℹ No QC samples found. Using default normalization method based on experiment type. #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ℹ Experiment type is "glycomics". Using `normalize_median_quotient()` + `normalize_total_area()`. #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ✔ Normalization completed. #> ℹ Preprocessing #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ── Normalizing data (Total Area) ── #> ℹ Preprocessing #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ✔ Total area normalization completed. #> ℹ Preprocessing #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ── Imputing missing values ── #> ℹ Preprocessing #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ℹ No QC samples found. Using default imputation method based on sample size. #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ℹ Sample size > 100, using `impute_miss_forest()`. #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ! `step_preprocess()` failed. Skipping... Error:  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ✔ Preprocessing [294ms] #>  #> ℹ Principal component analysis #> ! `step_pca()` failed. Skipping... Error: cannot rescale a constant/zero column to unit variance #> ℹ Principal component analysis #> ✔ Principal component analysis [13ms] #>  #> ℹ Differential expression analysis (limma) #> ℹ Number of groups: 4 #> ℹ Differential expression analysis (limma) #> ℹ Groups: "H", "M", "Y", and "C" #> ℹ Differential expression analysis (limma) #> ℹ Pairwise comparisons will be performed, with levels coming first as reference groups. #> ℹ Differential expression analysis (limma) #> ✔ Differential expression analysis (limma) [72ms] #>  #> ℹ Volcano plot #> ✔ Volcano plot [546ms] #>  #> ℹ Heatmap of significant variables #> ✔ Heatmap of significant variables [39ms] #>  #> ℹ Skipping `step_sig_enrich_go()` because input is not a glycoproteomics experiment and input has more than 2 groups. #> ℹ Skipping `step_sig_enrich_kegg()` because input is not a glycoproteomics experiment and input has more than 2 groups. #> ℹ Skipping `step_sig_enrich_reactome()` because input is not a glycoproteomics experiment and input has more than 2 groups. #> ℹ Derived trait calculation #> ✔ Derived trait calculation [2.4s] #>  #> ℹ Differential trait analysis (limma) #> ℹ Number of groups: 4 #> ℹ Differential trait analysis (limma) #> ℹ Groups: "H", "M", "Y", and "C" #> ℹ Differential trait analysis (limma) #> ℹ Pairwise comparisons will be performed, with levels coming first as reference groups. #> ℹ Differential trait analysis (limma) #> ✔ Differential trait analysis (limma) [81ms] #>  #> ℹ Heatmap of significant traits #> ✔ Heatmap of significant traits [38ms] #>  polish_report(result, tempfile(fileext = ".html"), open = FALSE) #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpItoejp/file1c7b25909a99.html"

title: Save GlySmith Result — quench_result
text: Save processed experiment, plots tables glysmith result object directory. README.md file also generated describe saved outputs.

title: Save GlySmith Result — quench_result
code: quench_result(   x,   dir,   plot_ext = "pdf",   table_ext = "csv",   plot_width = 5,   plot_height = 5 )

title: Save GlySmith Result — quench_result
text: x glysmith result object. dir directory save result. plot_ext extension plot files. Either "pdf", "png" "svg". Default "pdf". table_ext extension table files. Either "csv" "tsv". Default "csv". plot_width width plot inches. Default 5. plot_height height plot inches. Default 5.

title: Save GlySmith Result — quench_result
code: library(glyexp) exp <- real_experiment2 result <- forge_analysis(exp) #> ℹ Identification overview #> ✔ Identification overview [92ms] #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ── Removing variables with too many missing values ── #> ℹ Preprocessing #>  #> ℹ Preprocessing #> ℹ No QC samples found. what: Step: Differential Expression Analysis (DEA) using ANOVA — step_dea_anova
title: Step: Differential Expression Analysis (DEA) using ANOVA — step_dea_anova
text: Run differential analysis using ANOVA via glystats::gly_anova(), filter experiment keep differentially expressed variables using glystats::filter_sig_vars(). default, runs DEA main experiment (exp), can configured run derived traits (trait_exp) experiment objects.

title: Step: Differential Expression Analysis (DEA) using ANOVA — step_dea_anova
Step: Differential Expression Analysis (DEA) using ANOVA — step_dea_anova
text: Name experiment data ctx$data run analysis . Default "exp" differential expression analysis. Use "trait_exp" differential trait analysis. ... Step-specific arguments passed glystats::gly_anova(). Use format pkg.func.arg.

title: Step: Differential Expression Analysis (DEA) using ANOVA — step_dea_anova
text: glysmith_step object.

title: Step: Differential Expression Analysis (DEA) using ANOVA — step_dea_anova
text: Data required: Depends parameter (default: exp) Data generated: dea_res: DEA results (= "exp", default) dta_res: DTA results (= "trait_exp") sig_exp: filtered experiment (= "exp", default) sig_trait_exp: filtered trait experiment (= "trait_exp") Tables generated: dea_main_test, dea_post_hoc_test: Tables containing results (= "exp", default) dta_main_test, dta_post_hoc_test: Tables containing results (= "trait_exp")

title: Step: Differential Expression Analysis (DEA) using ANOVA — step_dea_anova
text: step supports following dynamic arguments: glystats.gly_anova.p_adj_method: P-value adjustment method (default: "BH"). glystats.filter_sig_vars.p_adj_cutoff: Adjusted p-value cutoff (default: 0.05). glystats.filter_sig_vars.p_val_cutoff: Raw p-value cutoff. glystats.filter_sig_vars.fc_cutoff: Fold change cutoff.

title: Step: Differential Expression Analysis (DEA) using ANOVA — step_dea_anova
code: step_dea_anova() #> <step "step_dea_anova()"> Differential expression analysis (anova) step_dea_anova(on = "trait_exp")  # Differential trait analysis #> <step "step_dea_anova(on = \"trait_exp\")"> Differential trait analysis (anova)

what: Step: Differential Expression Analysis (DEA) using Limma — step_dea_limma
title: Step: Differential Expression Analysis (DEA) using Limma — step_dea_limma
text: Run differential analysis using linear model-based analysis via glystats::gly_limma(), filter experiment keep differentially expressed variables using glystats::filter_sig_vars(). default, runs DEA main experiment (exp), can configured run derived traits (trait_exp) experiment objects. step recommended DEA method experiments.

title: Step: Differential Expression Analysis (DEA) using Limma — step_dea_limma
Step: Differential Expression Analysis (DEA) using Limma — step_dea_limma
text: Name experiment data ctx$data run analysis . Default "exp" differential expression analysis. Use "trait_exp" differential trait analysis. ... Step-specific arguments passed glystats::gly_limma(). Use format pkg.func.arg. example, step_dea_limma(glystats.gly_limma.p_adj_method = "BH").

title: Step: Differential Expression Analysis (DEA) using Limma — step_dea_limma
text: glysmith_step object.

title: Step: Differential Expression Analysis (DEA) using Limma — step_dea_limma
text: Data required: Depends parameter (default: exp) Data generated: dea_res: DEA results (= "exp", default) dta_res: DTA results (= "trait_exp") sig_exp: filtered experiment (= "exp", default) sig_trait_exp: filtered trait experiment (= "trait_exp") Tables generated: dea: table containing DEA result (= "exp", default) dta: table containing DTA result (= "trait_exp")

title: Step: Differential Expression Analysis (DEA) using Limma — step_dea_limma
text: step supports following dynamic arguments: glystats.gly_limma.p_adj_method: P-value adjustment method (default: "BH"). glystats.gly_limma.ref_group: Reference group comparison. glystats.gly_limma.contrasts: Custom contrasts multi-group comparisons. glystats.filter_sig_vars.p_adj_cutoff: Adjusted p-value cutoff (default: 0.05). glystats.filter_sig_vars.p_val_cutoff: Raw p-value cutoff. glystats.filter_sig_vars.fc_cutoff: Fold change cutoff.

title: Step: Differential Expression Analysis (DEA) using Limma — step_dea_limma
code: step_dea_limma() #> <step "step_dea_limma()"> Differential expression analysis (limma) step_dea_limma(on = "trait_exp")  # Differential trait analysis #> <step "step_dea_limma(on = \"trait_exp\")"> Differential trait analysis (limma)

text: Run differential analysis using t-test via glystats::gly_ttest(), filter experiment keep differentially expressed variables using glystats::filter_sig_vars(). default, runs DEA main experiment (exp), can configured run derived traits (trait_exp) experiment objects. use method experiments 2 groups.

title: Step: Derived Trait Calculation — step_derive_traits
text: Calculate glycan derived traits using glydet::derive_traits().

title: Step: Derived Trait Calculation — step_derive_traits
text: ... Step-specific arguments passed underlying functions. Use format pkg.func.arg.

title: Step: Derived Trait Calculation — step_derive_traits
text: glysmith_step object.

title: Step: Derived Trait Calculation — step_derive_traits
text: Data required: exp: experiment calculate derived traits Data generated: trait_exp: experiment derived traits Tables generated: derived_traits: table containing derived traits.

title: Step: Derived Trait Calculation — step_derive_traits
text: step supports following dynamic arguments: glydet.derive_traits.trait_fns: Custom trait functions calculate. glydet.derive_traits.mp_fns: Custom meta-property functions. glydet.derive_traits.mp_cols: Column names use meta-properties.

title: Step: Heatmap — step_heatmap
text: Create heatmap plot using glyvis::plot_heatmap(). heatmap visualizes expression values across samples.

title: Step: Heatmap — step_heatmap
text: Name experiment data ctx$data plot. One "exp", "sig_exp", "trait_exp", "sig_trait_exp". Default "exp". ... Step-specific arguments passed glyvis::plot_heatmap(). Use format pkg.func.arg. example, step_heatmap(glyvis.plot_heatmap.show_rownames = TRUE).

title: Step: Heatmap — step_heatmap
text: glysmith_step object.

title: Step: Heatmap — step_heatmap
text: Data required: Depends parameter (default: exp) Plots generated: heatmap: heatmap plot (= "exp") sig_heatmap: heatmap plot (= "sig_exp") trait_heatmap: heatmap plot (= "trait_exp") sig_trait_heatmap: heatmap plot (= "sig_trait_exp")

title: Step: Heatmap — step_heatmap
text: step supports following dynamic arguments: glyvis.plot_heatmap.show_rownames: Whether show row names. glyvis.plot_heatmap.show_colnames: Whether show column names. glyvis.plot_heatmap.cluster_rows: Whether cluster rows. glyvis.plot_heatmap.cluster_cols: Whether cluster columns.

title: Step: Heatmap — step_heatmap
code: step_heatmap() #> <step "step_heatmap()"> Heatmap step_heatmap(on = "sig_exp") #> <step "step_heatmap(on = \"sig_exp\")"> Heatmap of significant variables step_heatmap(on = "trait_exp") #> <step "step_heatmap(on = \"trait_exp\")"> Heatmap of traits

title: Step: Identification Overview — step_ident_overview
text: Summarize experiment using glyexp::summarize_experiment(). usually first step, step_preprocess(). light-weight run, always include .

title: Step: Identification Overview — step_ident_overview
text: ... Step-specific arguments passed underlying functions. Use format pkg.func.arg. example, step_ident_overview(glyexp.summarize_experiment.count_struct = FALSE).

title: Step: Identification Overview — step_ident_overview
text: glysmith_step object.

title: Step: Identification Overview — step_ident_overview
text: Data required: exp: experiment summarize Tables generated: summary: table containing identification overview experiment

title: Step: Identification Overview — step_ident_overview
text: step supports following dynamic arguments: glyexp.summarize_experiment.count_struct: Whether count structure composition.

title: Step: Principal Component Analysis (PCA) — step_pca
text: Run PCA using glystats::gly_pca() plot glyvis::plot_pca(). Loading plot glycoproteomics data can crowded many variables. Ignore resulting plot informative.

title: Step: Principal Component Analysis (PCA) — step_pca
text: Name experiment run PCA . Can "exp", "sig_exp", "trait_exp", "sig_trait_exp". ... Step-specific arguments passed underlying functions. Use format pkg.func.arg. example, step_pca(glystats.gly_pca.center = FALSE).

title: Step: Principal Component Analysis (PCA) — step_pca
text: glysmith_step object.

title: Step: Principal Component Analysis (PCA) — step_pca
text: Data required: exp: experiment run PCA Tables generated: pca_samples: table containing PCA scores sample pca_variables: table containing PCA loadings variable pca_eigenvalues: table containing PCA eigenvalues Plots generated: pca_scores: PCA score plot colored group pca_loadings: PCA loading plot pca_screeplot: PCA screeplot

title: Step: Principal Component Analysis (PCA) — step_pca
text: step supports following dynamic arguments: glystats.gly_pca.center: Whether center data (default: TRUE). glystats.gly_pca.scale: Whether scale data (default: TRUE).

title: Step: Preprocessing — step_preprocess
text: Preprocess experiment using glyclean::auto_clean(). step can omitted experiment already preprocessed.

title: Step: Preprocessing — step_preprocess
text: ... Step-specific arguments passed underlying functions. Use format pkg.func.arg. example, step_preprocess(glyclean.auto_clean.remove_preset = "discovery").

title: Step: Preprocessing — step_preprocess
text: glysmith_step object.

title: Step: Preprocessing — step_preprocess
text: Data required: exp: experiment preprocess Data generated: raw_exp: raw experiment (previous exp, saved reference) step special silently overwrites exp data preprocessed experiment. ensures matter preprocessing performed , "active" experiment always key exp. previous exp saved raw_exp reference.

title: Step: Preprocessing — step_preprocess
text: step supports following dynamic arguments: glyclean.auto_clean.batch_col: Column name batch information. glyclean.auto_clean.qc_name: Name QC samples (default: "QC"). glyclean.auto_clean.normalize_to_try: List normalization functions try. glyclean.auto_clean.impute_to_try: List imputation functions try. glyclean.auto_clean.remove_preset: Preset removing variables ("simple", "discovery", "biomarker"). glyclean.auto_clean.batch_prop_threshold: Proportion threshold batch correction (default: 0.3). glyclean.auto_clean.check_batch_confounding: Whether check batch confounding (default: TRUE). glyclean.auto_clean.batch_confounding_threshold: Threshold batch confounding (default: 0.4).

title: Step: ROC Analysis — step_roc
text: Perform ROC analysis using glystats::gly_roc(), extract top 10 variables highest AUC, plot ROC curves variables using glyvis::plot_roc().

title: Step: ROC Analysis — step_roc
text: ... Step-specific arguments passed glystats::gly_roc() glyvis::plot_roc(). Use format pkg.func.arg. example, step_roc(glystats.gly_roc.pos_class = "positive_class").

title: Step: ROC Analysis — step_roc
text: glysmith_step object.

title: Step: ROC Analysis — step_roc
text: Data required: exp: experiment perform ROC analysis Tables generated: roc_auc: table containing ROC AUC values variables Plots generated: roc_curves: ROC curves top 10 variables

title: Step: ROC Analysis — step_roc
text: step supports following dynamic arguments: glystats.gly_roc.pos_class: positive class.

what: Step: GO Enrichment Analysis on Differentially Expressed Variables — step_sig_enrich_go
title: Step: GO Enrichment Analysis on Differentially Expressed Variables — step_sig_enrich_go
text: Perform GO enrichment analysis differentially expressed variables using glystats::gly_enrich_go(). step requires one DEA steps run. execute glycoproteomics experiments exactly 2 groups. used glycomics experiments, step skipped. Use genes OrgDb background.

title: Step: GO Enrichment Analysis on Differentially Expressed Variables — step_sig_enrich_go
Step: GO Enrichment Analysis on Differentially Expressed Variables — step_sig_enrich_go
text: universe universe (background) use enrichment analysis. One "" (genes OrgDb), "detected" (detected variables exp). ... Step-specific arguments passed underlying functions. Use format pkg.func.arg. example, step_sig_enrich_go(glystats.gly_enrich_go.p_adj_method = "BH").

title: Step: GO Enrichment Analysis on Differentially Expressed Variables — step_sig_enrich_go
text: glysmith_step object.

title: Step: GO Enrichment Analysis on Differentially Expressed Variables — step_sig_enrich_go
text: Data required: exp: experiment perform GO enrichment analysis sig_exp: filtered experiment DEA, generated step_dea_xxx(). Tables generated: go_enrich: table containing GO enrichment results.

title: Step: GO Enrichment Analysis on Differentially Expressed Variables — step_sig_enrich_go
text: step supports following dynamic arguments: glystats.gly_enrich_go.OrgDb: Organism database (default: "org.Hs.eg.db"). glystats.gly_enrich_go.readable: Whether map readable gene names. glyvis.plot_enrich.type: Plot type ("dotplot", "barplot", etc.).

title: Step: GO Enrichment Analysis on Differentially Expressed Variables — step_sig_enrich_go

Step: KEGG Enrichment Analysis on Differentially Expressed Variables — step_sig_enrich_kegg
text: universe universe (background) use enrichment analysis. One "" (genes OrgDb), "detected" (detected variables exp). ... Step-specific arguments passed underlying functions. Use format pkg.func.arg. example, step_sig_enrich_kegg(glystats.gly_enrich_kegg.p_adj_method = "BH").

text: glysmith_step object.

title: Step: KEGG Enrichment Analysis on Differentially Expressed Variables — step_sig_enrich_kegg
text: Data required: exp: experiment perform KEGG enrichment analysis sig_exp: filtered experiment DEA, generated step_dea_xxx(). Tables generated: kegg_enrich: table containing KEGG enrichment results.

title: Step: KEGG Enrichment Analysis on Differentially Expressed Variables — step_sig_enrich_kegg
text: step supports following dynamic arguments: glystats.gly_enrich_kegg.OrgDb: Organism database (default: "org.Hs.eg.db"). glyvis.plot_enrich.type: Plot type ("dotplot", "barplot", etc.).

title: Step: KEGG Enrichment Analysis on Differentially Expressed Variables — step_sig_enrich_kegg

what: Step: Reactome Enrichment Analysis on Differentially Expressed Variables — step_sig_enrich_reactome
title: Step: Reactome Enrichment Analysis on Differentially Expressed Variables — step_sig_enrich_reactome
text: Perform Reactome enrichment analysis differentially expressed variables using glystats::gly_enrich_reactome(). step requires one DEA steps run. execute glycoproteomics experiments exactly 2 groups. used glycomics experiments, step skipped. Use genes OrgDb background.

title: Step: Reactome Enrichment Analysis on Differentially Expressed Variables — step_sig_enrich_reactome
Step: Reactome Enrichment Analysis on Differentially Expressed Variables — step_sig_enrich_reactome
text: universe universe (background) use enrichment analysis. One "" (genes OrgDb), "detected" (detected variables exp). ... Step-specific arguments passed underlying functions. Use format pkg.func.arg. example, step_sig_enrich_reactome(glystats.gly_enrich_reactome.OrgDb = "org.Mm.eg.db").

title: Step: Reactome Enrichment Analysis on Differentially Expressed Variables — step_sig_enrich_reactome
text: glysmith_step object.

title: Step: Reactome Enrichment Analysis on Differentially Expressed Variables — step_sig_enrich_reactome
text: Data required: exp: experiment perform Reactome enrichment analysis sig_exp: filtered experiment DEA, generated step_dea_xxx(). Tables generated: reactome_enrich: table containing Reactome enrichment results.

title: Step: Reactome Enrichment Analysis on Differentially Expressed Variables — step_sig_enrich_reactome
text: step supports following dynamic arguments: glystats.gly_enrich_reactome.OrgDb: Organism database (default: "org.Hs.eg.db"). glystats.gly_enrich_reactome.organism: Organism name (default: "human"). glyvis.plot_enrich.type: Plot type ("dotplot", "barplot", etc.).

title: Step: Reactome Enrichment Analysis on Differentially Expressed Variables — step_sig_enrich_reactome
Step: t-SNE — step_tsne
text: Perform t-SNE analysis using glystats::gly_tsne() plot t-SNE plot using glyvis::plot_tsne(). Note result t-SNE largely depends perplexity parameter. Usually trial--error process find best value iteratively. satisfied result, manually call glyvis::plot_tsne() different perplexity values find best one.

title: Step: t-SNE — step_tsne
text: Name experiment run t-SNE . Can "exp", "sig_exp", "trait_exp", "sig_trait_exp". ... Step-specific arguments passed glystats::gly_tsne() glyvis::plot_tsne(). Use format pkg.func.arg. example, step_tsne(glystats.gly_tsne.perplexity = 30).

title: Step: t-SNE — step_tsne
text: glysmith_step object.

title: Step: t-SNE — step_tsne
text: Data required: exp: experiment perform t-SNE Data generated: tsne: t-SNE result Plots generated: tsne: t-SNE plot

title: Step: t-SNE — step_tsne
text: step supports following dynamic arguments: glystats.gly_tsne.perplexity: perplexity parameter t-SNE. glystats.gly_tsne.dims: number dimensions t-SNE. glystats.gly_tsne.xxx: xxx parameters Rtsne::Rtsne().

title: Step: UMAP — step_umap
text: Perform UMAP analysis using glystats::gly_umap() plot UMAP plot using glyvis::plot_umap(). Note result UMAP largely depends n_neighbors parameter. Usually trial--error process find best value iteratively. satisfied result, manually call glyvis::plot_umap() different n_neighbors values find best one.

title: Step: UMAP — step_umap
text: Name experiment run UMAP . Can "exp", "sig_exp", "trait_exp", "sig_trait_exp". ... Step-specific arguments passed glystats::gly_umap() glyvis::plot_umap(). Use format pkg.func.arg. example, step_umap(glystats.gly_umap.n_neighbors = 15).

title: Step: UMAP — step_umap
text: glysmith_step object.

title: Step: UMAP — step_umap
text: Data required: exp: experiment perform UMAP Data generated: umap: UMAP result Plots generated: umap: UMAP plot

title: Step: UMAP — step_umap
text: step supports following dynamic arguments: glystats.gly_umap.n_neighbors: number neighbors. glystats.gly_umap.n_components: number dimensions. glystats.gly_umap.xxx: xxx parameters uwot::umap().

title: Step: Volcano Plot — step_volcano
text: Create volcano plot DEA results using glyvis::plot_volcano(). step requires one DEA steps run: step_dea_limma() step_dea_ttest() step_dea_wilcox()

title: Step: Volcano Plot — step_volcano
text: ... Step-specific arguments passed underlying functions. Use format pkg.func.arg. example, step_volcano(glyvis.plot_volcano.log2fc_cutoff = 2).

title: Step: Volcano Plot — step_volcano
text: glysmith_step object.

title: Step: Volcano Plot — step_volcano
text: Data required: dea_res: DEA results glystats::gly_limma() Plots generated: volcano: volcano plot

title: Step: Volcano Plot — step_volcano
text: step supports following dynamic arguments: glyvis.plot_volcano.log2fc_cutoff: Log2 fold change cutoff (default: 1). glyvis.plot_volcano.p_cutoff: P-value cutoff (default: 0.05). glyvis.plot_volcano.p_col: Column p-value ("p_adj" "p_val"). glyvis.plot_volcano.contrast: Contrast plot limma results.

what: Save or Load a Blueprint — write_blueprint
title: Save or Load a Blueprint — write_blueprint
text: write_blueprint() saves blueprint RDS file. read_blueprint() loads blueprint RDS file.

title: Save or Load a Blueprint — write_blueprint
Save or Load a Blueprint — write_blueprint
text: bp blueprint(). file character string giving name file save load .

title: Save or Load a Blueprint — write_blueprint
text: Invisibly returns blueprint object.

title: Save or Load a Blueprint — write_blueprint
code: bp <- blueprint(   step_preprocess(),   step_pca(),   step_dea_limma(), ) write_blueprint(bp, tempfile(fileext = ".rds"))
